text: A hand reaches for it, bringing the receiver up to the fa CASEY BECKER, a young girl, no more than sixteen.  A frie with innocent eyes.
Hello.
(from phone) Hello. Silence.
Yes.
Who is this?
Who are you trying to reach?
What number is this?
What number are you trying to reach?
I don't know.
I think you have the wrong number.
Do I?

It happens. Take it easy. CLICK! She hangs up the phone.  The CAMERA PULLS BACK to Casey in a living room, alone.  She moves from the living the kitchen.  It's a nice house.  Affluent. The phone RINGS again.
Casey grabs the portable.
Hello.
I'm sorry. I guess I dialed the wrong number.
So why did you dial it again?
To apologize.
You're forgiven. Bye now.
Wait, wait, don't hang up. Casey stands in front of a sliding glass door.  It's pitc outside.
What?
I want to talk to you for a second.
They've got 900 numbers for that. Seeya. CLICK!  Casey hangs up.  A grin on her face.
A big country home with a huge sprawling lawn full of big trees.  It sits alone with no neighbors in sight. The phone RINGS again.
Popcorn sizzles in a pot on the stove.  Casey covers it w lid, reaching for the portable phone.
Hello.
Why don't you want to talk to me?
Who is this?
You tell me your name, I'll tell you mine.
(shaking the popcorn) I don't think so.
What's that noise? Casey smiles, playing along, innocently.
Popcorn.
You're making popcorn?
Uh-huh.
I only eat popcorn at the movies.
I'm getting ready to watch a video.
Really? What?
Just some scary movie.
Do you like scary movies?
Uh-huh.
What's your favorite scary movie? He's flirting with her.  Casey moves away from the stove a seat at the kitchen counter, directly in front of the g door.
I don't know.
You have to have a favorite. Casey thinks for second.
Uh...HALLOWEEN. You know, the one with the guy with the white mask who just sorta walks around and stalks the baby sitters. What's yours?
Guess.
Uh...NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET.
Is that the one where the guy had knives for fingers?
Yeah...Freddy Krueger.
Freddy-that's right. I liked that movie. It was scary.
The first one was, but the rest sucked.
So, you gotta boyfriend?
(giggling) Why? You wanna ask me out?
Maybe. Do you have a boyfriend?
No.
You never told me your name. Casey smiles, twirling her hair.
Why do you want to know my name?
Because I want to know who I'm looking at. Casey spins around like lightning facing the glass door.
What did you say?
I want to now who I'm talking to.
That's not what you said.

What do you think I said? Casey CLICKS on the outside light.  A flood light illumin backyard.  Her eyes survey the grounds.  But it's empty. there.  She turns the light out. On the stove, the popcorn POPS.
I have to go now.
Wait...I thought we were gonna go out.
Nah, I don't think so...
Don't hang up on me.
Gotta go.
Don't... CLICK!  Casey hangs up.  She checks the glass door making it's locked and then moves to the stove as... THE PHONE RINGS. She slides the popcorn from the stove, reaching for the p
Yes?
I told you not to hang up on me.
What do you want?
To talk.
Dial someone else, okay?
You getting scared?
No-bored. CLICK.  She hangs up.  The phone RINGS again.  She grabs
Listen, asshole...
(deadly serious)

head_text.subj: NO, YOU LISTEN, YOU LITTLE BITCH. IF YOU
HANG UP ON ME AGAIN I'LL GUT YOU LIKE

text: Total silence.  He has gotten her full attention.
Is this some kind of a joke?
More of a game, really. Casey eyes the glass doors, then looks up the hallway to doors...moving to it.  It's unlocked.  She bolts it.
I'm two seconds from calling the police.

They'd never make it in time. Casey moves her face flush against the door, her eye look through the peephole. ANGLE THROUGH PEEPHOLE. A distorted view of the front porch.  It is empty.  She r bit, relieved.
What do you want?

(pure evil) TO SEE WHAT YOUR INSIDES LOOK LIKE. Casey's jaw drops as total fear storms her face.  She han phone, throwing it down on a side table when... THE DOORBELL CHIMES. Casey leaps out of her skin.  She turns to the door as it again.
(calling out) Who's there? Another CHIME.  She moves to it.

(louder) Who's there? No answer.  Fuck this.  It's time for the police.  She go the portable phone. Just as she picks it up... IT RINGS. Casey almost drops it, losing her breath... She brings it to her ear with trembling hands, saying nothing...listening, waiting... A long silence.  And then.
You should never say "Who's there?". Don't you watch scary movies? It's a death wish. Casey clutches the wall, nearly collapsing.  She tries he damndest to hang tough.
Look, enough is enough. You had your fun now you better leave me alone or else.
Or else what? CLOSE ON her face, her mind thinking, calculating...
My boyfriend will be here any second and he'll be pissed when I tell him...
I thought you didn't have a boyfriend. Busted.  She holds steady.
I lied. I do have a boyfriend and he'll be here any second and your ass better be gone.
Sure...
I swear it. And he's big and plays football and will beat the shit out of you.
I'm getting scared.
I'm telling you the truth. I lied before...
I believe you...
So you better leave.
His name wouldn't be Steve, would it? Silence.  Casey buckles at the knees, losing it.
How do you know his name?

Go to the back door and turn on the porch light--again. Casey, terrified, forces herself to move.. staggering to kitchen...to the glass doors.  Her shaky hand finds the l switch...she hits it.  The back yard is lit. Sitting in a lawn chair in the middle of the backyard is line backer of a guy, her boyfriend...
tied and gagged.  He's been roughed up, but he's alive. CLOSE ON his eyes..wide in fear..staring at his girlfrien pleading with her.
Oh Goddddd... Casey SCREAMS.  Her hand moves to the lock on the door.
I wouldn't do that if I were you. Terror rides Casey's face.  She's petrified.
Where are you?
Guess. Her eyes search the yard, combing bushes, trees.  He coul anywhere-anywhere.
(begging) Please don't hurt him.
That all depends on you.
Why are you doing this? Tears find their way, streaming down Casey's face.
I wanna play a game.
No...
Then he dies. Right now.
Which is it? A long silence.  Casey touches the glass...staring at STE big jock of a guy is crying too.
What kind of game?
Turn off the light. Her hand goes to the switch...Steve tugs and pulls at his straps...as if begging her...his face sweat and tears...
He disappears in the darkness.  Casey moves away from the back toward the living room, unbelieving, horrified.

Here's how we play. I ask a question. If you get it right-Steve lives. Three curtainless windows line one wall.  Casey crouches behind the couch, tipping a lamp cord from it's socket, d the room.  Her body quivers.
Please don't do this...
Come on. It'll be fun.
No...please.
It's an easy category. Movie trivia.
(begging) ..please...
I'll even give you a warm up question.
Don't do this. I can't..
Name the killer in HALLOWEEN.
No...
Come on. It's you favorite scary movie, remember? He had a white mask, he stalked the baby-sitters. Casey goes silent...a nervous wreck...she can barely spea less think.
I don't know...
Come on, yes you do.
Please..stop... Casey is SOBBING.
What's his name?
I can't think. Casey has officially reached hysteria, petrified beyond a reality.
Steve's counting on you. Suddenly...through tears...Godsent...
(a whisper) Michael...Michael Myers.
Casey SIGHS...relieved.
Now for the real question.
But you're doing so well.
Please go away! Leave us alone!
Then answer the question. Same category. Casey is a blubbering, wet mass on the floor.
..please..no...
Name the killer in FRIDAY THE 13TH. A mad smile purses Casey's lips.  She knows this.  She le through tears, screaming...
Jason! Jason!...JASON! A slight PAUSE.
I'm sorry. That's the wrong answer.
No it's not. It was Jason.
Afraid not.
It was Jason. I saw that godamned movie twenty times. It was Jason.
Then you should know Jason's MOTHER -Mrs.Vorhees was the original killer. Jason didn't show up until the sequel. Casey is stupefied.
You tricked me...
Lucky, for you there's a bonus round. But poor Steve...I'm afraid...he's out. This implication sends Casey running to the kitchen...to doors.  She flips on the porch lights to see...

eyes wide, sitting in the lawn chair...his belly gaping o mass of blood and ripped flesh...his insides lay on the g between his feet...steam rising. A SCREAM erupts from the bottom of her soul as Casey coll the floor...nearly passing out.  CLOSE ON her face...pale ghostly white.  She SOBS.
Final question. Are you ready? She doesn't answer.  A long, maddening silence.  Casey re and CLICKS off the light, making Steve go away...wishing, hoping...
..leave me alone..please...
Answer the question and I will. Casey is curled up on the floor like an infant, rocking s back and forth.
What door am I at?
What?

There are two doors to your house. A front door and a back one. If you answer correctly-you live. From where Casey sits she can see both front and back doo deliberates...with her last bit of strength she tries to strategize.  Eyeing both, the front door...the back door decide between the two.
Don't make me...I can't...I won't.

Your call. In the darkness, Casey crawls to the kitchen counter-she and grabs a long, sharp knife. Casey looks around her...she looks down the hall to the f door...then turns back to the kitchen glass door as it su SHATTERS TO BITS... as a lawn chair come flying through it.  Exploding glass everywhere. This incites Casey like fire.  She springs to her feet... out of the kitchen as a SHADOW moves quickly through the doorframe.

Somewhere in the house, back flat against a window, liste FEET ON CRACKING GLASS.  She turns and unlocks the latch, sliding it up. She can hear him move through the foyer... front door. Casey lifts herself up and puts her legs through the wind holds the knife in one hand, the phone in the other. Casey eases out the window, fumbling, dropping the knife the house.  She starts to reach for it.  Fuck it, she tak
Casey it at the back corner of the house.

I can hear you. I know you're here. Casey eases along a narrow path between a tall fence and of the house...going for the front yard.  She must pass t curtainless windows.  She gets to the first one and peeks The FIGURE has pulled open the foyer closet, searching fo Casey creeps along, to the next window, she looks in...th is completely on the other side of the room moving toward that leads to other parts of the house. She moves further along the house...squeezing by hedges.. third window...she peeks in to the FIGURE... STARING BACK AT HER... His face covered with a ghostly white mask, inches from h eyes piercing through...soulless...Casey SCREAMS BLOODY M a hand... CRASHES through the glass window grabbing hold of her nec beats at him trying to free herself...her nails dig into arm...she wrenches from side to side...finally breaking f the hands disappear inside the house...
Casey sails around the corner of the house, eyeing the fr It remains closed.  Her eyes cover the sprawling country suddenly....

in the distance, coming down the road towards the house.. recognizes them instantly.  Mom...Dad...she tears off acr yard toward them...moving like lightning... The car turns into the driveway...Casey SCREAMS, waving m rushing by a tree as...

Casey stumbles back, catching her balance...the FIGURE mo her, arm poised high...a flash of silver...and Casey is s across the chest.  She looks down to see her shirt blosso red...a look of bewilderment as she drops to one knee. The knife rises again...Casey throws her hand forward...t comes down...but it's blocked by the portable phone still hand.  She turns staggering to...
A MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE emerge from the parked car.  They mo front door completely unaware of what's happening to thei daughter, only feet from them.
Casey stumbles forward...her parents ten feet away...she mouth to scream but no sound resonates...she is beyond words...staggering, swaying...the FIGURE moving behind he
Her parents approach the door
That fish smelled strong.

I told you to send it back. The father discovers the front door ajar.  A puzzled look is right behind them with one arm outstretched.  If they' turn around... They enter the house and close the door as.... Casey collapses on the ground, clutching her bloody chest FIGURE upon her.
The father sees straight back into the kitchen...the shat patio door.
Jesus...
What is it? Where's Casey?
(calling out) Casey? Casey? In a split second they're both panic stricken.  The fathe searching the house frantically.  The mother is hysterica
CLOSE ON Casey...she's dragged by her feet through damp s life going fast from her body...her hand still clutching phone.
Back in the house.
Where is she?
Call the police. The mother moves  to the phone in the foyer, picks it up. is no dial tone.  She jiggles the base.
(searching) Casey? Where are you honey? Call the police, goddammit.
The phone's dead. The...the softest...faintest voice is heard...
(from phone) ..help me...
She's here, God, I can hear her. Where's my baby? The husband returns to the foyer finding his wife clingin phone.
Where is she?
I can hear her. Oh Mother of God, I can hear her. The father upturns the living room.
Casey! Casey!
Not my daughter...not my... The husband grabs hold of his wife.

Get in the car and drive down to the Mackenzie's. The other throws the front door open and rushes out...the moves through the house when a SCREAM echoes out.  That o wife.  He tears off for the front door.

The father rushes out the door to find his wife, on her k bent over, retching.  His eyes move beyond to a tree in t yard...his stomach fails him...his dinner rises...as he b witness to the single, most horrifying sight he'll ever s That of his only daughter as she hangs from a big oak tree...strung up...very much dead...her stomach ripped op
A teenage girl's room.  Neat and pinkish.  On the bed, am old stuffed animals lie opened school books. The CAMERA P desk against the wall where...

a young girl of 17, sits, her face glued to the computer in front of her.  CLOSE ON her face.  Sharp and clever wi lonely eyes.  She's comfortable in a plain, flannel night Her hands are at work, typing feverishly, when suddenly..
A noise behind her.  She turns abruptly, eyeing an open w across the room. A SCRATCHING sound.  She stands and move it.
Sidney sticks her head out the window.  The late night wi her face as a SHADOW appears just to the left of her, a h reaches out, grabs her and suddenly a FIGURE is on top of
Sid SCREAMS...pulling away from the figure...breaking fre falling back onto the floor.
(o.c.) Hey...it's just me. Sid looks up to see...
A young, strapping boy of seventeen.  Handsome and alluri star quarterback/ class president type of guy.  He sports that could last for days.
Billy? What the...
I'm sorry. Don't hate me.
What are you doing here?
You sleep in THAT? Billy pulls himself through the window.
(whispering) My dad's in the other room.
I'll only stay a sec. Suddenly... The bedroom door BURSTS open.  The doorknob catches on th closet door behind it jamming it, holding it in place.

(from behind door) What's going on in there? Billy quickly rolls out of sight behind the bed.  Sidney the door to reveal... MR. PRESCOTT, late 40's, a severe presence.  A distracted nervous and pre-occupied.
Are you okay?
Can you knock?
I heard screaming.
No you didn't.

No? Oh, well...I'm hitting the sack. My flight leaves first thing in the morning. Now the expo runs all weekend so I won't be back til Sunday. There's cash on the table and I'll be staying at the Raleigh Hilton...
..out at the airport...
..so call if you need me.
Got it. He gives the bedroom a quick once over.
I coulda swore I heard screaming. Sidney distracts him, giving him a peck on the cheek.
Have a good trip.
Sleep tight, sweetie. He gives her a wink and pulls the door closed.  Billy rea
Close call.
What are you doing here? Billy takes a flying leap and lands on the bed.
It just occurred to me that I've never snuck through your bedroom window.
Now that it's out of your system.
And I was home, bored, watching television, THE EXORCIST was on and it got me thinking of you.
Oh it did?

Yeah, it was edited for TV. All the good stuff was cut out and I started thinking about us and how two years ago, we started off kinda hot and heavy, a nice solid "R" rating on our way to an NC17. And how things have changed and, lately, we're just sot of...edited for television.
So you thought you could sneak in my window and we would  have little bump- bump.

No, no. I wouldn't dream of breaking your underwear rule. I just thought we might do some on top of the clothes stuff. She snuggles up next to him, planting a kiss on his lips. Passionate and gentle.  He, however, reacts like a shark, on top of her, his hands everywhere as he presses into her...Sidney breaks away.
Time to go, stud bucket. Billy sits up.  His heart isn't racing...it's POUNDING.
See what you do to me. Sweat has popped out all over his forehead, his breathing
You know what my dad will do to you?
I'm going...I'm going. He moves to the window.  She follows, motioning to his wo
I appreciate the romantic gesture. She gives him a kiss goodnight.  Sweet and simple.
(whisper) Hey..about the sex stuff. I'm not trying to rush you. I was only half serious. She kisses him again as he eases through the window.
Would you settle for a PG-13 relationship?
What's that? She pulls her flannel gown open for a split second...flas left breast.  His mouth drops open...surprise, shock.  Th meet.  They share a smile.
Get outa here.
CLOSE on Sidney snuggling her pillow, sleeping peacefully THE RADIO ALARM BLASTS from the night table loud enough t the dead.  Sidney bolts up.

(from radio) ..found brutally murdered... CLICK.  Sidney, quick with the reflexes, shuts it off ins A car trunk SLAMS shut outside. Sidney pulls herself out of bed and leans to the window j time to see her Dad jumping in his car.  She half waves d him but he doesn't see her.  He's as good as gone, pullin the driveway and disappearing down the road. A moment as Sidney stands at the window, staring out afte

head_text.subj: "BAYBORO HIGH SCHOOL. HOME OF THE FIGHTING BULLDOGS"

text: THE CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a picture perfect small t school.  Old and charming.  Students come and go, moving Nothing unusual, except for the... six police cars, four news vans, flashing cameras, and cr crowds of lookie-loo's gathered just off campus.

Sidney approaches the school seeing the commotion.  Four REPORTERS stand in front of four different cameras giving different news reports. She moves passed a policeman standing guard.  Her interes she stops at the first reporter who is...
Thirties.  He smart face is overshadowed by a flashy smil massive mane of chemically enhanced hair.

(for the camera) The small town of Bayboro, North Carolina was devastated last night when two young teenagers were found brutally butchered. Authorities have yet to issue a statement but our sources tell us that no arrest has been made and the murderer could strike again... ON SIDNEY.  Moved, disturbed.  From behind, a finger taps shoulder.  She spins around to see... Tatum Riley, same age, feisty, carefree.
Do you believe this shit?
What happened? They break away from the crowd and head for school.
Oh God! You don't know? Casey Becker and Steve Forrest were killed last night.
No way.
And not just killed, Sid. We're talking splatter movie killed-split open end to end.
Casey Becker? She sits next to me in English.
Not anymore. Her parents found her hanging from a tree. Her insides on the outside.
Do they know who did it?
Fucking clueless-they're interrogating the entire school. Teachers, students, staff, janitors...
They think it's school-related?

They don't know. Dewey said this is the worst crime they've ever seen. Even worse than... (stopping herself) Well it's bad. They're bringing in the feds. This is big. Sidney looks back at Gale, her face deeply pained.
A frumpy old woman, MRS. TATE, faces her class.  Her hand together.  A tragic look upon her face.

..a terrible tragedy. An unbearable loss. It's days like today we need prayer in school... Sidney sits near the rear of the room.  The desk in front sits vacant.  Sidney can't take her eyes of it. The door opens and a student opens with a slip of paper. s it to Mrs. Tate.
Sidney. It appears to be your turn.
The room is at capacity...wall to wall with police, and t Some sit, stand, lean... SHERIFF BURKE, a round man in his fifties, wipes the stre his face.
Who's up next? A young officer looks at the clipboard.  This is DEPUTY R better known as DEWEY.  He's a big guy, 20's, handsome in scrubbed-clean boyish way.
Sidney Prescott. Sheriff Burke gestures to bring her in.  PRINCIPAL HIMBRY an old codger of a man wearing a sour face speaks up.
Sidney Prescott. She was daughter of...
We all know Sidney, Mr. Himbry.
How she doin'?
She's adjusted well. Maintains an "A" average. You never know she... Himbry stops short, seeing Sidney in the doorway.  He ris seats her.
Hi Sidney.
Sheriff Burke. Dewey. Dewey shakes his head seriously.
It's Deputy Riley today, Sid.
How is everything?
Good.
And your Dad? How's he doing?
We're fine. Thanks.
We'll be brief, Sidney. The police have a few questions they'd like to ask you... Sidney eyes them all nervously.

Students sit at outdoor tables eating lunch.  Crowded at is the "gang".  This consists of Sidney, Billy and Tatum. Next to Tatum, sits her boyfriend STUART, with his arm dr across her back.  He's a Billy wannabe.  Almost the jock, handsome, almost cool.  He tries way to hard. Across the table is the fifth wheel, RANDY.  A tall and g with no such Billy-like aspirations.  A witty jokester wh elevates geek to coolness.
Hunt? Why would they ask if you like to hunt?
I don't know, they just did.
Because their bodies were gutted. Sidney flinches.
Thanks Randy.
They didn't ask me if I like to hunt.
Because there's no way a girl could have killed them.
That is so sexist. The killer could easily be female-BASIC INSTINCT.
That was an ice pick-not exactly the same.
Yeah, Casey and Steve were completely hollowed out. Takes a man to do something like that.
Or a man's mentality.
(quiet, almost to herself) How do you gut someone? All eyes turn to Sidney.  A serious silence.  And then:
You take a knife and slit from the groin to the sternum. Sidney shivers down to her soul.  The whole table rolls t at Stu.
What? She asked.
It's called tact, you fuckrag.
Sorry.

Remember in JAWS when they caught the wrong shark at first and Richard Dreyfuss cut it open to look foe body parts and all they found was a licence plate and all this white milky goo. Stu leans over and socks Randy in the arm.
You heard Billy-shut the fuck up.
Hey, Stu? Didn't you use to date Casey? Stu's taken back, a little off guard.
For about two seconds.
Before she dumped him foe Steve. Tatum turns to Stu, surprised.
I thought you dumped her for me.
I did. He's full of shit.
And are the police aware you dated the victim?
(offended) What are you saying? That I killed her or something?
It would certainly improve your high school Q.
Stu was with me last night.
Oooooh...before or after he sliced and diced.
Fuck you, nut case. Where were you last night?
Working, thank you.
I thought Blockbuster fired you.
Twice.
I didn't kill anybody.
No one's saying you did.
Besides- (perfect Stu mimic) "Takes a man to do something like that."
I'm gonna gut your ass in a second.
(to Stu) Did you really put her liver in the mailbox? I hear they found her liver in the mailbox.
(eyeing Sidney) Randy, you goon-fuck, I'm eating here. Stu nibbles at Tatum's neck.
Yeah, Randy, she's getting mad. I think you better liver alone. Stu cracks up at his own joke.  The others just MOAN.  Si about to crawl out of her skin, trying hard to ignore it
A huge two story country home with a spacious lawn. A yellow school bus stops in front of the house and Sidne off. The house looks big and lonely as Sidney moves up the wal front door.
Sidney is on the telephone.
(into phone) You sure I can stay over?  My dad won't be back til Sunday.
(through phone) No prob. I'll pick you up after practice.
Tell your mom I said thanks.
Yeah, yeah...are you okay?
Uh-huh, it's just...you know, the police and reporters...it brings it all back.
I'll be there by seven. I promise
Thanks, Tatum.
Later. Sidney hangs up.  She takes a seat at her computer and bo up.  She sits in front of it staring at the blue screen.. reflection staring back.

Sidney comes down the stairs, her arms carrying a change clothes, toothbrush, make-up... She opens the hall closet and pulls a small overnight bag top shelf.  Moving into the living room she loads it up, down on the sofa, hitting the TV remote.
A news reporter fades in.
(on TV) The entire nation was shocked today by the teen murders in North Carolina... Sidney switches channels.

The State Bureau of Investigation has joined forces with local authorities to help catch what the Governor has called the most heinous... The channel switches again.  Gale weathers appears, stand front of the school.  Her white teeth gleaming.

This is not the first time the small town of Bayboro has endured such tragedy. Only a year ago, Maureen Prescott, wife and mother, was found raped and murdered... An old black and white snapshot fills the screen-a woman, beautiful and familiar.

eyes frozen, mesmerized by the image.  Suddenly she CLICK off.  Her eyes go to the clock on the end table.  5:45 PM eyes then move to the framed photo next to it...the same white photo stares at her...a healthy, vibrant woman.  An version of Sidney. Sidney curls up on the sofa closing her eyes tight...
The clock on the end table reads 7:15 PM.  Sidney is fast on the couch.  The phone RINGS.  Sidney leaps up grabbing portable phone.
(from phone) Practice ran late. I'm on my way.
(eyes clock) It's past seven.
Don't worry. Casey and Steve didn't bite it til way after ten.
I'm not worried.
Good, 'cause I wanna swing by BLOCKBUSTER and get us a video. I was thinkin' Tom Cruise in ALL THE RIGHT MOVES. You know, if you pause it just right you can see his penis.
Whatever. Just hurry.
Bye. She hangs up the phone.  It immediately RINGS again.
(into phone) Tatum?
(from phone) Hello, Sidney. IT'S HIM.  THE VOICE FROM BEFORE.
Hi. Who is this?
You tell me. Sidney thinks, trying to place his voice.  It sounds a li distorted.
I have no idea.
Scary night, isn't it? With the murders and all, it's like right out of a horror movie or something.
Aha, Randy, you gave yourself away. Are you calling from work? Tatum's on her way over.
Do you like scary movies, Sidney?
I like that thing you're doing with your voice, Randy. It's sexy.
What's your favorite scary movie?
Don't start. You know I don't watch that shit.
And why is that?

(playing along) Because they're all the same. It's always some stupid killer stalking some big breasted girl-who can't act-who always runs up the stairs when she should be going out the front door. They're ridiculous. A brief silence.
Are you alone in the house?
That is so unoriginal. You disappoint me, Randy.
Maybe that's because I'm not Randy.
So who are you?
The question is not who am I. The question is where am I?
So where are you?
Your front porch. This gives her pause.  She moves to the window and pulls drapes.
Why would you call me from my front porch?
That's the original part. ANGLE THROUGH WINDOW.  She can't quite see all of the por

Oh yeah? Well I call your bluff. Sidney goes to the front door.  She unlocks the bolt, uns chain, and pulls the door open...revealing the front porc COMPLETELY EMPTY. She steps out onto it, phone still in hand.  A single lig overhead illuminating the porch, but little beyond.  Dark all around.
So where are you?
Right here. Sidney peers out into the darkness past thick shrubs that either side of the porch.
Can you see me right now?
Uh-huh.
What am I doing? She sticks her finger up her nose, pretending to pick.  S No answer.
Good try, Randy. Tell Tatum to hurry. Bye now.
If you hang up, you'll die just like your mother. Sidney stops dead in her tracks, speechless.
(deadly) Do you want to die, Sidney? Your mother didn't. His seriousness unnerves her.  Sid flies off the handle.
She hangs up on him.  Moves back inside the house.  Locks and bolts the door when...

rushing her, ramming into her side..the phone flies..the on top of her as she goes down...SCREAMING... She looks up to see the FIGURE, darkly dressed with a pal distorted face, white and ghostly...a mask. Her instincts surface and she kicks up with her foot maki contact with his leg...he topples over...coming right at hand finding her neck.  Suddenly, along, silver blade app above her. Sidney pulls, jerks, twists...finally she lifts her torso knocking the FIGURE off her...sending him reeling into th room.  Wasting no time, Sidney leaps to her feet. She moves to the front door, unlocks it...pulls it open.. catches on the chain.  Shit!  She pushes it closed again behind her..the FIGURE has risen, knife in hand. Sidney pulls on the chain and then-inexplicably turns and RUNS UP THE STAIRS.  The FIGURE right behind her.

The FIGURE leaps at Sidney taking hold of her foot, she g madly at the wall...her hands grasp a framed painting-a q country home, subdued colors, done in oils-she rips it fr wall swinging it behind her... It catches the FIGURE head on, smashing against his skull him backwards, tumbling down the stairs.  Sidney races to bedroom...

She locks the door shut, the pulls her closet door open, the edge right at the door knob just as... THE FIGURE POUNDS AGAINST THE BEDROOM DOOR... ramming it, it rips open, but the closet door catches it crazy vice-like hold. Sidney grabs the desk phone.  It's dead...off the hook do The figure rushes the door several times..the frame splin won't give. Sidney is at her computer, she punches at the keypad madl CLOSE ON SCREEN AS WORDS APPEAR.
The knife slashes through the crack in the door wildly.
Sidney presses SEND when it occurs to her-all is quiet. FIGURE is gone.  A fearful silence.  She looks around...t sound her own rapid, terrified BREATHING.
"Stay calm.  Police enroute." Suddenly a NOISE at the window...Sidney looks up to see..
her boyfriend, staring at her, surprised.
Oh Billy...Please...God...
I heard screaming. The door was locked. Are you okay...

He's here. He's trying to kill me... Billy pulls himself through the window.  As he does, a sm object falls from his dark jeans.  It hits the floor as S eyes it...a sleek, compact cellular phone. Sidney stops in her tracks.  Their eyes meet...an eternit SIREN is heard in the distance.  Sidney bolts...
Hey...wait...what's goin.. Billy reaches for her.  Sidney unblocks the bedroom door out of the room.
Sidney nearly falls down the stairs...
She rips the chain off the door, pulls it open, coming fa face with a white, ghostly mask. A massive SCREAM erupts from her gut as...
to find Dewey-Deputy Riley, holding it.  Red lights flash BLAST vas car after car surrounds the house. Sidney falls into the safety of Dewey's arms.
The yard is a whirlwind of activity.  An ambulance, squad cops everywhere...
as it SMASHES against the hood of a police car.  His hand being cuffed, his rights being read.
(screaming) I didn't do anything! Sid...where's Sid? Ask her, she'll tell ya... Dewey holds a car door open as Sheriff Burke steps out.
We got him, Sheriff. Billy Loomis.
Hank Loomis' kid? Aw..Jesus...
He's her boyfriend. They approach Billy as he's being placed in a squad car.

Sheriff...I didn't do it...please, call my Dad..please... The squad car disappears with Billy as another car comes in front of the house.  Tatum gets out, freaked beyond be Back to the Sheriff and Dewey as they storm across the ya
I was first to respond.
What were you doing out here?
Drive by patrol.
How is she?
She's tough.
Have to be. The shit she's gone through. Across the yard sits Sidney, in the back of an ambulance PARAMEDICS check her out. Sheriff Burke and Riley approach.
We're seeing a lot of you today. She tries to smile but fails.
You gonna be able to come down to the station and talk to us a bit?
..yeah... TATUM appears, barreling past an OFFICER.
What happened? Oh God... Tatum rushes to her, grabbing hold of her.
(to Tatum) What are you doing here?
Oh, God, Sid, I'm sorry I was late.
You can't be here, Tatum. This is an official crime scene.
It's okay. She was supposed to pick me up.
Her dad's out of town. She's staying with us.
Does mom know?
Yes, you doofus. Two news vans come driving up the street.
The vultures are coming. Let's get you out of here.
A big, white news van comes to a stop in front of the hou side door slides open and Gale Weathers hops out just in see Sidney being escorted to a squad car.
I'll be damned. Jumping from the driver's seat is KENNY, Gale's cameraman flunky.  An earnest young chap on the chubby side.
What? What?
Jesus! The camera-hurry! But it's too late.  Sidney is as good as gone.  Gale sees moving quickly to her car.
Excuse me? Tatum looks up to see Gale Weathers rushing her.
Was that Sidney Prescott they took away?
I don't know. Tatum hops in her car, ignoring her.
What happened to her?
I'm not talking to you. Tatum's car peels out as Kenny comes running up with his
Where'd she go? Gale spins around, flashing her pearly whites.
Look, Kenny, I know you're about fifty pounds overweight but when I say hurry please interpret that as...MOVE YOUR

head_text.subj: FAT TUB OF LARD ASS NOW

text: Gale moves back to the van leaving Kenny miffed.
A small town station.  The bull pen is a little square ro four desks and tonight--it's hopping.  Cops everywhere.
Sidney sits at a desk drinking a cup of water.  She wears Sheriff's jacket over her shoulders.  Dewey approaches.
Did you reach my Dad?
You're sure it was the Hilton?
At the airport.
He's not registered. Could he have gone to another hotel?
I don't know. I guess.
We'll find him, Sid. Don't worry. Sidney stares blankly, numb.
Billy sits opposite Sheriff Burke.  Next to Billy, sits h father, HANK LOOMIS, an older version of Billy.
What are you doing with a cellular telephone, son?
It's my phone. He was just playing around with it.
You got some ideas of playing around, boy.
I didn't call anyone with it. I just took it for fun.
Everybody's got one now. Why don't you check the phone bill for chrissakes. Call my carrier--AirFone Comp. They'll have records of every number dialed.
Thank you, Hank. We're on it. What were you doing out at Sidney's tonight?
I just wanted to see her, that's all.
You rode your bike out there?
Yes, sir.
And last night? Sidney said you crawled through her window last night too?
(surprised) You were out last night?
I watched TV for awhile but the I felt like going for a bike ride.
Did you ride past Casey Becker's house?
No, I didn't. I didn't kill anyone, Sheriff.
We're gonna have to keep you, Billy. The governor's got SBI, FBI, and god knows who else on their way down here. Billy fights tears.
This is crazy. I didn't do it. Sheriff Burke eyes him up and down, very carefully.
Tatum has joined Sidney.  The sheriff's door opens and Bi led out by a coupla UNIFORMS.  Burke and Dewey appear in watching Tatum comfort Sidney.
That ghost mask is sold at both Kroger's and WalMart. Neither of which keep purchase records.
What about the cellular phone bill?
They're pulling Loomis' account. But it'll be morning before we see something. You think he did it?
Twenty years ago I woulda said not a chance. But these kids today...damn if I know.
(o.s.) Hey...Dewey. Can we go now?
Hold up a sec...
She staying with you?
We haven't located her Dad yet.
(o.s.) Goddammit, Dewey! Dewey turns to her, his face red.
What did Mama tell you? When I wear this badge you treat me like a man of the law.
I'm sorry, Deputy Dewey-boy but we're ready to go.
Use the back way. Avoid the circus.
The door opens and Sidney, Tatum, Dewey, and a coupla OFF exit avoiding the horde of REPORTERS that can be seen aro corner waiting anxiously at the front entrance.
I'll get the car. Wait here. Dewey takes off.  From the darkness of the alley, Gale We appears with Kenny and his camera.  They've been waiting.
Hello Sidney. Sidney spins around to see Gale, standing, smiling at her Sidney's body tightens and her face goes taut.
Some night. Are you alright? Their eyes meet in cold familiar stare.  Sidney says noth She's visibly shaking.
What happened?
She's not answering any questions. Just leave us alone, okay?
It's okay, Tatum. She's just doing her job. Right, GALE?
Yes, that's right. Dewey, in a squad car, turns into the alley and pulls up. other news people have wisened up.  They begin to flock t
How's the book?
It'll be out later this year. Sidney tries to contain herself..squeezing a clenched fis
I'll look for it.

I'll send you a copy. In a blurred, unexpected instant, Sidney brings her fist SMASHING it hard into Gale Weathers's face.  The impact s reeling backwards, knocking into Kenny as they both tumbl pavement. ON SIDNEY...breathing deep, a sense of satisfaction on he
A spacious bedroom.  Typical.  Tatum and Sidney lay on th They both wear night shirts.
God, I loved it. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Bitch went down. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Sid--SuperBitch! Dewey appears in the doorway holding a bag of ice.
I thought you might want some ice for that right hook. Sidney sits up, takes the ice, and puts it on her hand.
I'll be right next door. Try to get some sleep. Dewey moves back out the door.
Any word on my Dad?
(turning to her) Not yet, but we're looking. If you need anything...
Yeah, yeah, yeah... Dewey smiles, pulling the door closed on his way out.  Si back down.
Just another sleepover at the Riley's.
Just like old times, ain't it?
No, nothing's like it used to be. Sidney rolls over at her side, away from Tatum. A telephone RINGS somewhere in the house.
Do you really think Billy did it?
He was there, Tatum.
I knew this guy was too perfect. He was destined to have a flaw. A KNOCK at the door.  It opens and a friendly, graying wo in.  This is MAMA RILEY.  She wears a comforting smile.
Telephone, dear.
Who is it?
It's for Sid
My Dad? Mama Riley shakes her head sadly.
Take a message.
It's alright. I'll get it. Sidney takes off out the door.  Mama Riley motions to Tat
(whispers) How is she? Tatum shrugs.
Sidney grabs the phone at the end of the hall.
Hello?
(from phone) Hello Sidney. IT'S HIM.  The CAMERA does a Hitchcock as Sidney's entire goes weak..his VOICE moving through her..invading her.  S OUT.
Mama Riley turns in the doorway.  Tatum comes bolting out bedroom.
(from phone) Poor Billy-boyfriend. An innocent guy doesn't stand a chance with you.
Looks like you fingered the wrong guy...again.
Who are you?
Hang up, Sid.
Don't worry. You'll find out soon enough. I promise. Mama Riley BEATS on a closed bedroom door.
Dewey! Dewey!
This is gonna be fun, Sidney. Just like old times. CLICK. Dewey flies out of his room wearing only his boxers...hol gun.
What? What? The phone goes dead.  Sidney stands frozen.
The morning sun shines high over Bayboro Townsquare.  Car life, townsfolk stir as the picture postcard community aw from a restless sleep.
Sidney and Tatum sit at the kitchen table, dressed and re school as Mama Riley serves up breakfast.  A small televi on the counter BLARING. Dewey, in uniform, stands near the door, talking on the p
I think you girls really should stay home today.
Your objection is duly noted.
I'd rather be around a lot of people, Mama Riley. From the TV, Sidney hears her name, "SIDNEY PRESCOTT..." go to the television.

(on TV) ..who escaped a vicious attack last night was the daughter of Maureen Prescott who was brutally killed last year when convicted murderer Cotton Weary... INSERT of COTTON WEARY, in prison fatigues.  A once hands now haggard and worn.

(cont'd) ..broke into their home and savagely raped and tortured the deceased. Cotton Weary is currently awaiting appeal for the death sentence handed down after the young Sidney testified against him. She was the key witness in the state's prosecution...
It's never gonna stop. Is it? Dewey is off the phone.
Billy was released. His cellular bill was clean. He didn't make those calls.
Somebody called me, Dewey. I'm not making it up.
I know. We're checking every cellular account in the county. Any calls made to you or Casey Becker are being cross- referenced. It's gonna take time but we'll find him.
And my Dad? Any word on him? Riley shakes his head "no".

Once again, REPORTERS line the street attacking students make their way to school, asking questions, hungry for th teenage insight. Dewey's patrol jeep cruises by.  Sidney watches from the passenger's window.
Dewey pulls up in front of the school.  Tatum hops out wh lingers, suddenly unsure.  Dewey takes notice.
Hey, it's school. You'll be safe here. Sidney forces herself out of the jeep as a microphone is her face...
How does it feel to almost be brutally murdered? Dewey leaps from the car, intercepting the reporter.
Leave the girl alone, will ya? She wants to go to school. Sidney eyes the newsvan that's pulled up behind her.  The door slides open and Gale Weathers steps out.
Come on, Sid.
Just a sec...I need to talk to someone. She heads over to Gale.

Sidney, puts her head down, hiding her face...avoiding ot reporters as she makes her way to... Gale who sits in the open door, checking her face in a mi Makeup tries hard to hide Sid's handwork-a swollen black right cheek. Gale spots Sidney immediately and leaps to her feet.
Stop right there. Sidney throws her hands up in surrender.
I'm not here to fight.
Just stay back.
I want to talk to you.
(calling into the van) Kenny. Camera. Now. Kenny's head darts out from the van.
Off the record. No cameras.
Forget it. Sidney contains herself.
Please. You owe me.
I owe you shit. Gale moves inside the van.  But Sidney is relentless.
You owe my mother.
Your mother's murder was last year's hottest court case. Somebody was gonna write a book about it.
And it had to be you with all your lies and bullshit theories.
What is your problem? You got what you wanted. Cotton Weary is in jail. They're gonna gas him. A book is not gonna change that.
Do you still think he's innocent? Gale's interest is peaked.  She eyes Sidney suspiciously.
He was convicted in a court of law. Your testimony put him away. It doesn't matter what I think.
During the trial, you did all those stories about me. You called me a liar.
I think you falsely identified him. Yes.
Have you talked to Cotton?
Many times.
Has his story changed?
Not one word. He admits to having sex with your mother but that's all.
He's lying. She wouldn't have touched him. He raped her, then butchered her. Her blood was all over his coat.
He was drunk that night. He left his coat at your house, after your mother seduced him...
I saw him leaving wearing it.

But couldn't it have been someone else you saw wearing that coat? The same person who planted it in Cotton's car, framing him? The same person who really killed your mother? A long beat.  Sidney considers this for the millionth tim
No, Cotton murdered my mother. But there's doubt in her voice.  Gale's face lights up.
You're not so sure anymore, are you? Sidney clams up.
No, it was Cotton. Tatum comes waltzing up.
(to GALE) Nice welt. Gale ignores her, zeroing in on Sidney, half realizing.
The killer is still on the loose, isn't he? These murders are related.
Yo--let's rock. Sidney starts to fidget.
I'm sorry I mangled your face. She take off with Tatum.  Gale calls after her.
Wait, Sidney, don't go... But Sidney and Tatum have already disappeared in the crow students moving across campus. Gale looks to Kenny.
Jesus Christ! An innocent man on death row. A killer still on the loose. Kenny, tell me I'm dreaming.
You want to go live? Gale's mind races with possibilities.
No, not so fast. We have nothing concrete.
When did that ever stop you? You can't sit on this. This is huge.
If I'm gonna blow this up-I need hard proof.
But it's so much easier when we make it up.
Not this time. I owe Cotton that much. Hell, even I thought that man was guilty.
Tatum and Sidney make their way across campus.
Just relax. You're at school now. No one can get you here.
But if it wasn't Billy it could be anybody. He could be here at school right now. They move up the walk as a FIGURE falls in step behind th sporting a WHITE GHOST MASK.
Serial killers are smart by definition. They minimize their risk. They plan and pre-calculate everything. Showing up here would be the most lame-brain move he could make.
He promised me he'd be back. As easy as the figure appeared, it disappears-falling out unseen by either of them.

I wouldn't put too much stock in a psycho's promise. They move up the front steps toward the main doors of the as the GHOST MASKED FIGURE reappears...standing at the to steps...Sidney sees it first, stopping dead in her tracks She steps back, spinning around to find... A GHOST FACE behind her as well, both of them approaching in on her.  Sidney starts to SCREAM when the two ghosts b LAUGHING, tearing off across campus.
In front of the school we catch up a REPORTER doing a liv He holds a mask in his hand.
This morning several students, in what appears to be a prank, have been spotted wearing masks. School officials have yet to comment but this is the same type of mask worn by the killer...
Just before the bell.  The hallway is congested with stud heading to class.  Tatum is at her locker with Sidney.
This is a mistake. I shouldn't be here.
I want you to meet me here right after class, okay? Billy appears in the crowd, with Stu tagging behind.  Tat him first.
Shit, what is he doing here?
I bet he's pissed.
Just ignore him. You had good reason to think what you did. Billy and Stu approach.  Billy's face is solemn.
Hi, Sid. Can we talk a sec? Sidney says nothing.  She can barely look at him.  Tatum intervenes.
You know if I were accused of carving up two people, I'd take the opportunity to skip school.
Hey, go easy, Tatum. He didn't do it.
Talk to me, Sid. Suddenly, a SCREAM erupts.  All eyes go to a GHOST MASKED running down the hall, screaming wildly, running amuck.
Why are they doing this?
Are you kidding? This is like Christmas. Billy punches Stu in the side.
Owwww...
You open your mouth and stupidity pours out.
Sorry. Sidney, clearly upset, takes off down the hall.  Billy ra after her.
(yelling) Stay away from her, Billy. Tatum SLAMS her locker door shut as the bell RINGS.
With first period underway, the halls have cleared.  One struggling students can be seen rushing to class. Sidney moves quickly down the hall, rounding a corner, ru smack into...
They collide hard catching Sidney off guard, scaring the of her.  She falls backwards, but Billy catches her fall.
Jesus, SHIT!
Hey, hey, it's just me. Sidney pulls away from him quickly.  Billy feels the slig
What? You don't still think it's me? Sidney catches her breath.
No...I don't...it's just...Oh God, Billy, someone was there, someone tried to kill me.
The police say I scared him off. It wasn't me, Sid.
I know. He called again last night at Tatum's house.
See, it couldn't have been me. I was in jail, remember?
I'm so sorry...please understand.
Understand what? That I got a girlfriend who would rather accuse me of being a psychopathic killer than touch me.
You know that's not true.
Then what is it? Is there somebody else?
No...
Is it the sex thing? Am I being too pushy?
No, it's me, Billy. I need time. I'm still adjusting to my mom.
It's been a year since she died.
(correcting him) Tomorrow. One year tomorrow.
When are you gonna let that go, Sid? When my mom left my dad--I just accepted it. This is the way it is. She's not coming back.
(sharply) Your parents split up. It's not the same thing. Your mom left town, she's not in a coffin somewhere.
You have to move on, Sid. Sidney starts to walk away but turns back, angry.

I'm glad to know you're coping so well with life, Billy. But some of us aren't so perfect. Some of us are just trying to hold on. Sidney disappears through a door marked GIRL'S BATHROOM, Billy alone in the hallway.  He SMACKS his forehead, piss himself.
Large and spacious.  Closed bathroom stalls line one wall row of sinks and a huge mirror.  Sidney enters as TWO GIR and talk--each from their respective stalls.
She was never attacked. I think she made it all up.
Why would she lie about it?

For attention. The girl has some serious issues. Sidney listens intently. A toilet FLUSHES.  Sidney quickly jumps in a stall, hidin as GIRL #1 appears from a stall.  She looks like that voi snotty little twit.
What if she did it? What if Sidney killed Casey and Steve?
And why would she do that?
Maybe she was hot for Steve and killed them both in a jealous rage. Another toilet FLUSHES.
Why would Sidney want to be with Steve? She has her own bubble-butt boyfriend Billy.
Maybe she's a slut just like her mom. INSIDE THE STALL Sidney listens.  Her face weakening.
You're evil.
Please, it's common knowledge. Her mother was a trollop. GIRL #2 appears from her stall--another twit.  They both front of the mirror adjusting two snotty faces.
Cut some slack. She watched her mom get butchered.

And it fucked her up royally. Think about it. It makes perfect sense. Her mom's death leaves her distraught and hostile at a cruel and inhumane world, she's disillusioned, where's God, etc. Completely suicidal. And one day she snaps. She wants to kill herself but realizes teen suicide is out this year. And homicide is a much healthier therapeutic expression. From the stall, Sidney listens, her heart pounding, jaw q
Where do you get this shit?
Ricki Lake. The two girls exit.  Sidney moves out of the stall, catch reflection in the mirror.

Pathetic. Water DRIPS somewhere from a leaky pipe as wind WHISTLES the cracked transom above the bathroom door.  It sound al a whisper,   "Siddneey..." Sidney spins around.  What the...  She checks out the bat The doors to the stalls are all closed.  She bends down a beneath them, looking for feet.  No one.  Nothing. Sidney turns back to the mirror.  Suddenly...
(o.c. whisper) Siddneey... Unmistakable this time.  The VOICE strikes Sidney like a through the eye.  It comes from one of the stalls.  She s thunderstruck, eyeing the stalls thru the mirror.
Is someone there? A long, morose silence.  And then:

(softly, simply) It's me, Sidney. Sidney spins around.  Fuck no!  HE'S HERE.  Terror floods face.  She eyes the exit door, then the row of stalls she pass to get to it. She checks under the stalls again.  Nothing...where the f he?  She takes a step forward when... TWO FEET step down from a toilet onto the floor in the la Sidney's face draws tight as the stall door begins to CRE She bolts forward, making a break for it...but slips on t floor...her feet flying out from under... Sidney reaches out...grabs hold of a sink...saves herself falling...she glimpses a GHOST MASK in the mirror coming A hand grabs her shoulder as she SLAMS her body through t door...narrowly escaping.
Sidney flies out of the bathroom door SCREAMING...burning hallway, not looking back.  A TEACHER, hearing her SCREAM out from an open doorway...as Sidney sprints by him, not stopping...running madly.
CLOSE on a red-faced Principal Himbry as he reads someone act.

I'm sickened. Your whole havoc-inducing, thieving, whoring generation disgusts me. The CAMERA SWINGS AROUND to reveal two GHOST MASKED STUDE standing at attention.  Mr. Himbry rips the mask off of o student's heads.
Two students have been savagely murdered. And this is how we express our compassion and sensivity? He rips the mask off the other student.
We throw on a mask and dance around campus just hoping someone else gets butchered before we get bored again. You're both expelled. The GHOSTS doth protest...
Aw, come on, Mr. Himbry, it was just a joke.
Yeah, that's not fair. A deep rooted hostility has taken over Mr. Himbry's face. student budges, scared to even breathe.

No, it's not fair. Fairness would be to rip your insides out and hang you from a tree so you can be exposed for the desensitized, heartless little shits that you are. Suddenly the door BURSTS open and Sidney appears, hysteri
(crying) He's here...I saw him...he's here... Mr. Himbry rushes to her, arms outstretched.
Easy child. Sidney collapses in his arms.
Dewey's patrol jeep is parked in front of the school.  He in the open driver's door talking on the radio.
(from radio) She's okay. Looks like some boys were teasing her. Himbry's shutting down the school though. I want you to take look around.
Yes, sir, sheriff. Dewey shuts the jeep door and heads for campus when Gale appears, her fake face aglow.
Hi! Gale Weathers. Field Correspondent, INSIDE STORY.
I know who you are, ma'am. How's the eye?
Productive. So they're closing down the school?
Well..uh...yes ma'am. For the time being. Dewey heads for the school building. Gale scurries along flirtatiously.
And why is that? Has something happened?
You're not supposed to be here, ma'am.

I know, I should be in New York covering the Sharon Stone stalker but who knew? Please, call me Gale. You look awfully young to be a police officer. Dewey's eyes wander down to Gale's long legs, the way her move as she walks...he's clearly distracted.
I'm twenty-five years old, ma'am.

Twenty-five, huh? In a demographic study I proved to be most popular amongst males, 11-24. I just missed you. Of course, you don't look a day over twelve, except in the upper torso area. Does the force require that you work out? Dewey looks away, blushing a bit.

No, ma'am. Because of my boyish good looks, muscle mass has increased my acceptance as a serious police officer. They approach the school's front entrance.  Suddenly, Mr. VOICE in amplified through intercoms across campus via th system.  They stop to listen.

(via PA) "Your attention please. Due to the recent events that have occurred and until it comes to a resolve--effective immediately--all classes are suspended til further notice. The Bayboro Police Dept. has also asked me to announce a city wide curfew beginning at 6 o'clock PM. I repeat..." Gale speaks over Mr. Himbry's voice.
Boy, you people sure do make fuss over a serial killer.
Serial killer is not really accurate, ma'am. The killer has yet to strike twice.
Well, we can hope, can't we? We certainly don't have any leads. A ghost mask, a cellular phone--not much there.
We're tracking the cellular phone bill.
Really? You small town guys are good. And have you located Sidney's father?
No, not yet.
He's not a suspect, is he?
We haven't ruled out that possibil... Dewey, realizing he's said too much, clams up.
If you'll excuse me, ma'am.
Am I keeping you? I'm sorry.
That's quite alright. If I may say so, ma'am, you're much prettier in person. Dewey starts up the school's front steps as the bell RING
So you do watch the show? He turns to her earnestly as STUDENTS come pouring out th doors.
I just turned 25. I was 24 for a whole year.
You are precious. Please, call me Gale. She smiles deliciously, gives him a wink, then struts off Dewey, like a nervous little school boy watches her go.
School is clearing out.  The halls have begun to empty as escorts Sidney down the hallway.
It was just some sick fuck having a laugh.
It was him, Tatum. I know it. Tatum wants to believe her but...
You are not to be alone again. Is that clear? If you pee--I pee. Stu appears.
Is this not cool or what? Hey, Sid, what happened?
For once, Stu, drop it.
Okay, but whatever you did--the entire student body thanks you. Stu moves to Tatum and gives her a kiss.
And to celebrate this impromptu fall break, I propose we have a party. Tonight, my house.
Are you serious?
My parents are out of town. It'll be like my hurricane bash last year. Nothing extreme. Just a few of us, hangin'. Tatum warms to the idea.
This could be good. What do you think, Sid?
I don't know...
Come on. Pathos has it's perks. Sidney considers trying hard to be good spirited.
Remember, there's safety in numbers.
(giving in) Yeah, okay...whatever.
Cool. See you guys tonight. Bring food. Stu speeds off, sliding down the empty hallway.
Mr. Himbry sits at his desk staring at the ghosts masks b him.  He picks one of them up, snickering.

Damn... He stands and moves to the closet next to his office door pulls it open to reveal a mirror hooked inside the door. the mask on, pulling it over his face, looking in the mir when... A KNOCK AT THE DOOR stops him.  He rips the mask off his turns to his office door and opens it to reveal... AN EMPTY DOORWAY.  He pokes his head into the outer offic and looks around.  But no one's there.

Yes? Hello? The place is empty.  A little suspicious he closes the do catching his reflection in the closet mirror.  He looks a mask in his hands.  Jesus, even he's jumpy.  Two seconds ANOTHER KNOCK AT THE DOOR.  Himbry grabs the door quickly time throwing it open.  Again no one's there.  He steps o the outer office determined to catch a prankster.

Completely empty.  Mr. Himbry moves through the outer off into the school corridor.  The overhead lights have been off and the corridor is now dark and deserted.  He looks down the hall.  Only a JANITOR is seen in the distance pu broom.
Little shits. Mr. Himbry returns to his office.

Himbry reenters his office, moving to his desk, when he s closet door NOW CLOSED SHUT. This gives him a pause-he had left it open.  Hadn't he? he can't remember.  He shifts uneasy, reaching for the do pulling the door open to reveal... AN EMPTY CLOSET.  He stands still a moment, suddenly real someone could easily now be standing behind the open clos Nervously, he pushes it shut to reveal... NOTHING.  Himbry shakes away his jitters, realizing he's himself.  He continues to his desk, pushing his office do when... A GHOST MASKED FIGURE lunges from behind it...knife in ha Quick and easy.  Three quick jabs to the stomach and Himb down.  The GHOST MASKED FIGURE towering above him.

The late afternoon sun is quickly disappearing. Tatum and Sidney rock on the front porch looking out into small town neighborhood.  Dewey's patrol jeep is parked i driveway. Despite loud music, BLARING from an inside stereo, this i moment.
Maybe Cotton Weary is telling the truth. Maybe he was having an affair with your mom.
So you think my mom was a slut too?
I didn't say that, Sid. But you know there were rumors. Your dad was always out of town on business. Maybe your mom was a very unhappy woman.
If they were having an affair how come that Cotton couldn't prove it in court?
You can't prove a rumor. That's why it's a rumor.
Created by that little tabloid twit Gale Weathers.
(delicately) It goes further back, Sid. There's been talk about other men.
And you believe it?

Well...you can only hear that Richard Gere-gerbil story so many times before you have to start believing it. A long silence as Sidney agonizes over all of this.  She and moves to the edge of the porch and stares out onto th neighborhood.
If I was wrong Cotton, then he's still out there.
Don't go there, Sid. You're starting to sound like some Wes Carpenter flick. Don't freak yourself out--we've got a long night ahead of us.
You're right. I'm cracking up. Ignore me.

Come on, let's rock. Sid follows Tatum inside the house never seeing the GHOST FIGURE that stands across the street, under a tree.  His so subtle and unobtrusive you'd have to see this movie a time to know he was there all along.
Stu is moving along main street when Billy comes barrelin to him.
How'd you do?
Piece of cake. She'll be there.
Thanks, butt wart. You did good.
So you gonna try and make up with Sid?
Duh...that's quick.
I was just asking. Why are you always at me?
Because I'm trying to build your self- esteem. You're far too sensitive.
Oh.... Billy thumbs Stu's forehead.
You ready to party hard tonight?
You know it. They come to a building centrally located in the heart of Street.  A huge, blue monstrosity that's bigger than the bank and post office combined. The sign in front reads BLOCKBUSTER.
You typical Blockbuster--huge and crowded.  Randy, in his Blockbuster get up, is busy reshelving returns when Stu a knocking the videos out of his hand.
Jesus, this place is packed.
(picking up videos) We had a run in the mass murder section.
You coming tonight?
Yeah, I'm off early--curfew you know. (looking off) Now that's poor taste.
What? Randy refers to Billy who stands down the aisle talking t GIRLS.  (The twits from the bathroom perhaps.)
If you were the only suspect in a senseless bloodbath would you be standing in the horror section?
It was all a misunderstanding. He didn't do anything.
You're such a little lap dog. He's got killer printed all over his forehead.
The why'd the police let him go?
Because, obviously they don't watch enough movies. This is standard horror movie stuff. PROM NIGHT revisited. Randy moves down the aisle, reshelving videos.
Why would he want to kill his own girlfriend?
There's always some stupid bullshit reason to kill your girlfriend. That's the beauty of it all. Simplicity. Besides, if it's too complicated you lose your target audience.
So what's his reason?
Maybe Sidney wouldn't have sex with him.
She's saving herself for you.
Could be. Now that Billy's tried to mutilate her, you think Sid would go out with me?
I think her father did it. How come they can't find his ass?

Because he's probably dead. His body will come popping out in the last reel somewhere...eyes gauged. See, the police are always off track with this shit, if they'd watch PROM NIGHT they'd save time. There's formula to it. A very simple one. Everyone's always a suspect--the father, the principal, the town derelict...
Which is you...
So while they're off investigating a dead end, Billy, who's been written off as a suspect, is busy planning his next hunting expedition.
(o.c.) How do we know you're not the killer? Randy spins around to find Billy right behind him.  Buste
Uh...hi, Billy.
Maybe your movie-freaked mind lost it's reality button? Randy shrugs, laughing it off.
You're absolutely right. I'm the first to admit it. If this were a scary movie, I'd be the prime suspect.
And what would be your motive?
It's 1995--motives are incidental.
Dewey's patrol jeep makes it's way down mainstreet.  It's dark.  The street is close to deserted.
Dewey's behind the wheel having a heated conversation wit while Sid stares out the window.
A party? Mom's gonna kill you. Then me.
Don't be so self-righteous. It's just a little blow out--we'll be perfectly safe. Sid stares out the window. CLOSED SIGNS fill the storefro few people rush to their car, in a hurry to beat curfew.
God, look at this place, it's THE TOWN THAT DREADED SUNDOWN.
Hey, I saw that movie. True story, 'bout some killer in Texas.
Hey, Sid. Just think if they make a movie about you. Who's gonna play you?
Oh, god... Dewey comes to a stop, parking the car in front of the po station. He looks to Sid with a brotherly smile.
I see you as a young Meg Ryan myself.
Thanks, Dewey. But with my luck they'd cast Tori Spelling.
They pile out of the jeep.  Dewey heads for the station.
I'll just be a few minutes. Don't go far. The girls take off for the local supermarket that sits ac street.
Is Billy going to be there tonight?

He better not be. I told Stu to keep his mouth shut. I think we can live without EVERYBODY'S ALL AMERICAN for one night. They approach the grocery store.  Small and simple.  Sid grab a shopping cart from the bin and enter the store, pu cart through two sliding glass doors. A lone CHECKOUT LADY behind the counter, big and frumpy, from counting money.
You girls gonna have to hurry it up. We're under curfew.

Two minutes tops. They make a bee-line for the junk food section just as th automated doors slide shut behind them and a... GHOST MASKED FIGURE appears, out of nowhere, standing jus outside, watching, quietly through the glass store window
Sheriff Burke's face heats up as Deputy Riley marches in, hurriedly.
Dewey! Where the hell you been, boy?
Keeping my eye on Sidney.
Listen up, Dewey, because it's bad. Real bad. Aircomp just faxed us. The calls were listed to Neil Prescott--Sidney's father. He made the calls with his cellular phone. It's confirmed.
Couldn't his cellular number have been cloned?
There's more. Guess what tomorrow is? The anniversary of his wife's death. It all fits. He's our man.
Have you contacted the bureau?
They believe he's out of state by now. We'll keep roadblocks and curfew in effect through the night. If he's not picked up by morning--we'll do a house to house.
You think he could still be in town?
He'd have to be crazy. Where's Sidney?
She's with my sister. Should I bring her in?
Hold off for now. Just stay close to her.
She'll be with her friends over at Stu Maker's tonight.
Watch her. Don't let on--just keep your eyes out.
Yes, sir.
Sidney and Tatum push a basket through the junk food sect store is completely empty.  The girls gab freely.
Billy's right. Whenever he touches me, I just can't relax.
You have a few intimacy issues as a result of your mother's untimely death. It's no big deal. You'll thaw out.
But he's been so patient with me, Tatum. You know, with all the sex stuff. How many guys would put up with a girlfriend who's sexually anorexic?
Billy and his penis don't deserve you. Sidney grabs some chips and salsa from the shelf.  Down t through the storefront window the GHOST MASKED FIGURE sti watching their every move.
Sid pushes the cart out of the glass door with Tatum ridi The GHOST MASKED FIGURE is nowhere to be found.
What do you think about when you're having sex?
With Stu, there's little time to stop and reflect. But sometimes before, to relax and get in the mood, I think about Grant Goodeve. Sid pushes the cart and Tatum across the street.
Who?

Grant Goodeve--the oldest brother on EIGHT IS ENOUGH. Remember that show? He was the one who lived off alone. He would come around every now and then with his guitar and sing "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." He had all these brain dead sisters and that idiot brother from CHARLES IN CHARGE. God, I was in love with Grant, he was so hot. The show came on every day after school right during my puberty years. Grant Goodeve was very instrumental in my maturing as a woman.
How does that get you in the mood with Stu?
During foreplay, I sing the theme song to myself. "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." It's a real turn on.
No way.
Grant wrote the song himself. I'm convinced the lyrics had a secret meaning, "Eight is enough..." Sid pushes the cart up to Dewey's jeep.  Tatum hops off.
What secret meaning? Like a Satanical thing?
Watch the show, Sid. His basket is bigger than the one you're pushing.

Oh, Sidney. WHAT? A guy can talk tits til he's dead but the minute you mention an eight inch weenie. Watch out. Sidney stops just short of a laugh.  Tatum pulls the back door, loading the groceries in.  Behind her, the GHOST MA FIGURE appears, just out of their sight, behind the jeep' back door.
There's that sense of humor. I knew it still existed. Ohh, Sid, let's have some fun tonight.
Deal. Sidney moves to the back door and closes it shut, when fr behind... DEWEY stands.  Sid jumps, startled.
You girls ready.
Yeah.
Looks like I'm your personal bodyguard tonight, Sid.
No, Dewey. You'll ruin the whole night.
Sorry, police orders. I'll stay out of the way, I promise.
Shit. Tatum kicks the shopping cart out of the way, blindly.  I down the road by itself, gaining speed on a decline runni into the GHOST MASKED FIGURE who stops the cart cold with hand.

Dewey's jeep makes it's way down a long, winding road.  H illuminate the thick woods that line each side.  Followin them at a discreet distance is a huge white newsvan. Dewey comes to the end of the road.  It dead ends at... STU'S HOUSE which sits alone in a clearing, big and omino no neighbors in sight.  A huge old home just ripe for a n fun and...terror. From the looks of things the party has already started. BLARING. A few KIDS hang on the porch.
A big room with KIDS sprinkled throughout-smoking, drinki cutting up.  A stereo BLASTS music while the TV airs arou clock killer coverage. Tatum and Sid enter with groceries.  Various FRIENDS gree
Caterer's here. The girls carry bags through a hallway that opens up onto enormous kitchen.  Stu and some GUYS are leaning over the drinking beer through a funnel.
That's mature.
Where you guys been? We had to start without you.
The newsvan pulls up and parks unobtrusively on the side road a few feet down from the front yard.
Kenny and Gale move around inside the van.  Kenny hovers control panel complete with video monitors.
What's the plan?
Prep the compact, we'll hide it in a window and tape all of tonight's festivities. Kenny picks up a compact video camera the size of his fis checks its battery pack.
The control board's glitched. You know we can't carry a live picture.
What's the delay?
About thirty seconds.

As long as it records I don't give a shit. We're not doing a remote. Gale slides open the side door and steps out into the dar not seeing the FIGURE that stands behind her.  A hand gra shoulder, Gale's heart stops as she spins around to find. Dewey, smiling, extremely pleased to see her.
Evening, ma'am.
Deputy...good evening.
What brings you out to these parts?
You never know when or where a story will break.
Not much story here. Just a bunch of kids cutting loose.
Then what are you doing here?
Keeping an eye on things. Checking the place out.
Mind if I join you? Dewey considers for a whole two seconds.
Not at all. Gale leans in the van, grabs the camera from  Kenny's han throws it in her bag.  She gives Kenny a wink.

CLOSE ON a microwave.  Popcorn POPS inside.  CAMERA WIDEN REVEAL... Sid, Stu, and Tatum moving about the kitchen, preparing a food feast.  Other TEENS pop in and out. Randy appears am them.  He carries an armful of videos.
I thought we'd make it a BLOCKBUSTER night. He lets the videos splatter across the kitchen counter. Tatum dive in.
I thought everything was checked out.
I had 'em hid in the foreign section. Sidney peruses the videos.

The garage door is activated.  It begins to r upward, taking Tatum with it.  She SCREAMS MADLY.

Tatum's arms and legs fly about violently as she tries to herself from the door, but it moves too fast, carrying he She looks above to see where the door rolls back into gar rafters just as her neck hits the first beam, SNAPPING in

Billy? Jesus, you scared me. Stu appears.
(with a wink) Dude. What are you doing here?
I was hoping Sid and I could talk.
If Tatum sees you--she'll draw blood.
You guys can go up to my parents room? To talk and...whatever.
Subtlety, Stu. Look it up.
It's okay. We need to talk. Sid grabs his hand and leads him up the staircase.  Randy from the kitchen just in time to see Sid and Billy disapp upstairs.

He came to make up.

Like you had one.
Kenny fidgets at the control board.  He hits a coupla but bangs the side of the monitor and a picture emerges...the room.  The camera is positioned just above the television

The party is in full swing.  Several TEENS sit right in f the television.  Because of the camera's position they ap be staring right into the lens. Suddenly, the van's side door slides open and Gale pops i

A large, master bedroom with glass doors that lead out on balcony. Sid and Billy stare at each other for a long moment.  Awk
So...
So...I'm sorry. I've been a selfish shit and I'm sorry.
No, Billy. I'm the one who's been selfish and self-absorbed with all of my post traumatic stress.
You lost your mom...
But you're right--enough is enough. I can't wallow in the grief process forever and I can't keep lying to myself about who my mom was. Billy bows his head quietly, knowingly.
I think in some weird analytical, psychological bullshit way I'm scared I'm gonna turn out just like her, you know? Like the bad seed or something...
Oh Sidney...
Everytime I get close to you I see my mom. I know it doesn't make sense.
Sure it does. It's like Jodie Foster in SILENCE OF THE LAMBS when she kept having flashbacks of her dead father.
But this is life. This isn't a movie.
Sure it is, Sid. It's all a movie. Life's one great big movie. Only you can't pick your genre. Billy moves to her.  They embrace, tenderly.
I wanna let go. I do...
Ssshh...everything's gonna be okay. I promise. Sidney takes the initiative, acting on impulse, kissing h and hard.  She breaks away passionately, out of breath.
Why can't I be a Meg Ryan movie? Billy nibbles her neck.
Sshh..it's okay.
Or even a good porno.
(shocked) What? She stares at him, her eyes sexually charged.
You heard me.
(incredulous) Are you serious?
(surprising herself) Yeah...I think so. They smile at each other.
The camera sits on the book shelf lodged between two knic completely inconspicuous. The CAMERA WIDENS to reveal sev TEENS watching the TV--the horror diehards.
Look, here it comes. SPLAT!
The blood's not the right color. Why do they do that? It's too red.
Here comes another...
Predictable. Knew he was going to bite it.
How can you watch this shit over and over?
Shhhhh.
I wanna see Jamie Lee's breasts. When do we see Jamie Lee's breasts?
Not until TRADING PLACES in '83. Jamie Lee was always the virgin in horror movies. She didn't show her tits until she went legit.
No way.
That's why she always lived. Only virgins can outsmart the killer in the big chase scene in the end. Don't you know the rules? Stu finishes his beer.
What rules? Randy hits the pause button on the remote and stands in f the television, explaining.

There are certain rules that one must abide by in order to successfully survive a horror movie. For instance: 1. You can never have sex. The minute you get a little nookie--you're as good as gone. Sex always equals death. 2. Never drink or do drugs. The sin factor. It's an extension of number one. And 3. Never, ever, ever, under any circumstances, say "I'll be right back."
Wanna another beer?
Yeah.
I'll be right back. Everybody "ooohhs".
There he goes folks--a dead man. Wave bye-bye.
Gale and Kenny watch the monitor.  The party is clearing A RAP at the van door.  Gale pulls it open to see Deputy standing, his face all smiles.
Sheriff just radioed me. I'm gonna check out a possible lead. Thought you might like to join me.
What kind of lead?
A car was spotted in the bushes a little ways up the road.
I'd love to. If you're sure it's alright?
Ma'am, I am the Deputy of this town.
Can I bring Kenny?
(too quickly) NO! I mean...I should probably take just you. Gale steps out of the van turning back to Kenny.
I'll be back. She slides the van door closed.
Gale heads for Dewey's patrol jeep.
Actually, I thought we could walk. It's not far. Gale appears skeptical, but smiles anyway.  She's genuine smitten by this young guy.
SCARY MUSIC fills the room.  The party is reduced to the in front of the television.
(pointing to TV) Look, here comes the obligatory tit shot.
Beautiful! Finally!
Billy and Sidney are going at it...passionately.  He has buried in her neck.

(to herself) "Eight is enough to fill our lives with love..." It's working.  Sidney pushes Billy off her as she pulls h over her head.  She fumbles with the clasp of her bra as CAMERA RUSHES IN on her breasts.  Just as Sid's bra strap of her shoulders... Billy moves in front of the CAMERA, pulling his jeans off Blocking Sidney from view.
Back in the living room, the horror fest continues when t RINGS.  Everyone ignores it.  It RINGS again. Finally, Randy grabs the receiver from the side table.
Hello? Yeah....HOLY SHIT. Randy, freaked, drops the phone, finds the TV remote and the movie, the others protest "Hey, Put is back..." etc.

Listen up. They found Principal Himbry dead. He was gutted and hung from the goal post on the football field. This stills the room.  Complete silence as the news sinks different faces...a moment of devastation..disbelief.  An
So what are we waiting for?

Let's get over there before they pry him down. And in seconds the room is empty as everyone bolts for th door..HOOTIN' and HOLLERIN' ...leaving Randy, near drunk, the living room.  He returns to the movie.
We were just getting to the good part.

Kenny is barely watching the monitor, he reached boredom ago.  He finds a bag of Cheetos and chows down when he he SCREAMING from outside.  He peers out the window to see t of the PARTY KIDS pile into two cars and race off down th He chews a Cheeto slowly, his interest piqued.

Uh-huh.
You don't still think it was me?
No, but if it were you, that would have been a very clever way to throw me off track. Using your one phone call to call me so I wouldn't think it was you. Billy stands up.

Sidney sees the FIGURE immedietely, SCREAMING.  Billy tri calm her, oblivious to the advancing GHOST.

ON SIDNEY as red crimson splatters across her face...as t is thrust in and out of Billy who tries hard to put up a fight..but it's useless...he never had a chance.  His bod to the floor..lifeless.

as he watches Billy's body come to a still before quietly turning his attention to... SIDNEY who stands, numb...scared to death.  And only when GHOST takes a step forward does Sidney break.  She takes a rocket...leaping over the bed and out the door.
Sidney tears out the door and down the hall, coated in Bi blood.

as he catches up with her, grabbing hold of her collar. away from him...her shirt ripping down the back. Her hands find a door knob and she goes for it, pulling t open...moving quickly inside...locking it behind her.

Total darkness.  Sidney's hands scour the wall for a ligh The doorknob turns...the lock holds..as the door is nearl from it's hinges...and then... NOTHING.  All goes silent.  Only Sidney's rapid BREATHING the space around her. Sidney, trembling, shaking, reaches above her, feeling, u finds a string.  She pulls it...as a lightbulb SWITCHES o overhead. She's in a small box of a room.  The door is on one side, narrow staircase on the other.  She eyes the doorknob, th staircase...contemplating...but it's an easy decision.  T fucking way she's going up to the attic. She unlocks the door and pushes on it.  But it won't give pushes on it again.  It's locked from the other side.  Sh turns to the staircase.
A long, deserted country road.  In the distance, a single flashlight beams ahead, the only light in the black night and Dewey can be heard.
So is Dewey your real name?
Dwight. Dewey was something I got stuck with a long time ago.
I like it. It's... sexy.
Nah... it's just this town's way of not taking me serious.
What about Gale Weathers? I sound like a meteorologist... CLOSE ON Gale and Dewey, walking closely, side by side- flirtatiously.  Gale is surprisingly nervous.

Are all the local boys as sweet as you? Dewey blushes.  He starts to say something when headlight behind them.  They both spin as TWO CARS loaded with KIDS racing right at them. Dewey grabs Gale and pushes her off the road... just as t speed by, oblivious to them.
Gale lands face up with Dewey right on top of her.  He st glance in her eyes before rolling off her.

What's that? Dewey looks to where gale points.  He finds the flashligh aims it into the bush.  The tail end of a car is just vis

Sidney's father?
We gotta get back. Jesus. He's here. What the fuck is he doing here? Dewey is panicked.  He grabs Gale and they race off down
Randy continues to watch TV.  He is now sloppy drunk, com involved in the movie on the screen. SCARY MUSIC SWELLS, filling the room.
(to TV) No, Jamie. Look behind you! Watch out! Behind you! And if he followed his own advice, he would see the GHOST FIGURE that stands directly behind him...knife poised.

just in time to see the GHOST MASKED FIGURE turn away fro leaving him unharmed, moving instead, out the front door, thirty second walk to the newsvan.

I'll get my camera. They split up.  The CAMERA FOLLOWS GALE as she rushes to newsvan, throwing open the door.
